@mims I remember a class on "opportunity cost" where I made the observation that at the extremes the concept just gets silly. If your life's meaning derives from running the farm that's been in your family for generations the cost of not selling the land to developers is irrelevant.

@MichaelStahlke But when I read the (wonderfully illustrated) version of Hans Christian Andersen's The Little Match Girl, I insisted we no longer sell that book & toss any copies we had into the garbage. Andersen's world was different than ours, I know that. But to me it's kiddie death porn. 2/2

@MichaelStahlke Years ago my wife opened & ran a children's book & toy store, the best such store in central Massachusetts, "The Elephant's Child," a magical place. I was deeply involved in its operation. And, we have 3 kids. So I've read 1000's of children's books, most of them wonderful. 1/2
